rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Decisions about local parks are a matter for your local authority, not the Government or House of Commons.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

attributes.action: Rename Green Park to Queen Elizabeth Park in our late Monarch’s honour
attributes.background: I would like the Govt to seek the endorsements necessary and rename Green Park as Queen Elizabeth Park as a memorial to our late Queen,  which is at the heart of London. I would like this formally done on the anniversary of her death in 2023.
attributes.additional_details: Green Park is already a Royal park with a link to the monarchy. There is no clear or historical reason why it is named Green Park. During the period of national mourning it became the place closest to Buckingham Palace where her public could lay flowers, leave messages and reflect on her life. It was also central to her funeral. The late Queen herself loved to be in nature. I myself was moved by the carpet of floral tributes laid there.

departments.name: Department for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport

attributes.action: Put South Africa on Green List Immediately
attributes.background: Many people want to go to South Africa to be with their families for Christmas. We want South Africa to be put back on the Green List of countries immediately. As we have been told the Omicron Varient is very mild and the vaccines still protect people from this variant.
attributes.additional_details: We have been waiting a long time to see our families and some of us have not seen our loved ones in over 2 years. We believe the decision should be made as soon as possible to reinstate green list status immediately. All the African states should not have been put on the red list to start with.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/589382

attributes.action: Law that British public have  a vote on how the country deals with immigration.
attributes.background:
Make it a law that the British public have a say on how many refugees and immigrants
We allow into great Britain.
attributes.additional_details:
We feel that there is not enough housing and job's to accommodate thousands of
Refugees and immigrants. The uk is a small 
Island and sooner or later we will run out of room and all our green land will be gone to housing. Due to covid-19 alot of businesses
Have closed and thousands of people are unemployed and looking for work. As a country we can't keep paying out billions in benefits sooner or later the money will run

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  We understand you'd like a referendum related to immigration, but we're not sure what you'd like the vote to choose between. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Temporarily ban the sale and use of disposable barbecues during lockdown
attributes.background: Countless warnings from fire services not to use disposable barbecues (and campfires) due to the risk of forest fires are being ignored. A local forest (Wareham, Dorset) has lost 220 hectares in a recent fire, taking over 150 firefighters to battle and there is an ongoing extreme fire risk.
attributes.additional_details:
As people begin to socialise with others outside but not at home, the use of these BBQs is likely to soar, posing an even greater risk to life and the environment and increasing strain on emergency services. 
Disposable barbecues are a well known danger, scorching the ground below during most uses and remaining hot for some time. Decimation of green areas by fire further accelerates climate change. This is in addition to their environmentally unfriendly single-use nature.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Rollout new ELMS schemes in full by 2024
attributes.background: It has been reported that the Government may delay, review or replace the new Environmental land management schemes (ELMS) schemes. To protect agricultural emissions targets the Government should roll out the new schemes in full in 2024, as planned.
attributes.additional_details: A report by the Green Alliance (https://green-alliance.org.uk/briefing/delaying-elm-would-halve-its-carbon-savings-by-2035/) has noted that delaying this scheme 2 years would mean losing out on an agricultural emissions savings of 50% by 2035. Seeing as UK agriculture in 2019 accounted for 46.3 megatons of greenhouse gas emissions released into the atmosphere, we cannot risk delaying this scheme as we will not hit our climate goals.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Require school summer holidays in England to be Mid June to mid July
attributes.background: Move the summer holiday in England to earlier in the year. Mid June to mid July. Due to covid we have all started to discover that there are some amazing places to holiday in this green and pleasant land. Unfortunately it often rains during the summer school holidays as they are in August.
attributes.additional_details: I propose that school holidays should be moved to a time of year that the chance of rain is less likely, probably some time in June and July.

attributes.action: Stop covid green passports and discrimination based on vaccination.
attributes.background: Every person must decide for herself and is against human’s rights to force people to accept any vaccine, medicine or treatment and discrimination based on an injection should be prosecuted.
attributes.additional_details: Government should understand that forcing people to do something they don’t want is a form of harassment and obstructing some rights and freedoms is against the law.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/575801

attributes.action: Maintain travel corridors for countries with lower COVID rates than the UK's
attributes.background: Eliminate the compulsory 14-day quarantine upon entry to the UK for anyone arriving from countries where the number of COVID positive cases per 100,000 people over the last 7 days is lower than it is for in the UK. We believe the current system is arbitrary and illogical and should be changed.
attributes.additional_details: The Government appears to update the 'green list' of countries where you do not need to self-isolate upon entry to the UK with no logical basis. The Government should not require people to self-isolate when they are entering the UK from an area where the COVID rate is lower than the UK's. The current system creates uncertainty for families, businesses, hospitality and airlines and must change.

attributes.action: Give local areas the right to protect wild life, green spaces and marine life.
attributes.background: This petition calls for the parliamentary debate on Government planning policy on green spaces, that will have a detrimental effect on local wild life, marine life and natural habitats.
attributes.additional_details:
It will protect an established green space that is a natural habitat for many different species of 
wildlife, marine life, plants and birds.

rejection.details:
Local authorities already have powers to protect wild life and designate green areas, and have a public authority duty to have regard to conserving biodiversity.

We could accept a petition calling for local authorities to be given new powers, or have new obligations, but it would need to be clear what changes you want to be made to current arrangements.

attributes.action: Prevent religion being used as an excuse to build on protected green belts
attributes.background: After hearing about "The Eternal Wall of Prayer" project being built in a protected green belt, I think religious belief should not be a valid excuse in a secular country to build on an otherwise restricted area
attributes.additional_details: Green belts exist to preserve areas and prevent urban sprawl. Building this blatant tourist attraction is bound to create exactly a sprawl, as people move to provide facilities to visitors of the Wall. Religious belief and the wall being "A vision from God" should not be accepted as a valid reason to build on protected land, especially when other more useful buildings could be provided instead, and when not even locals are allowed to build.

rejection.details:
It is possible to get planning permission for building on Green Belt land, and this is the case whether a project is religious in nature or not.

You can find out more about the role of the Green Belt in the planning system here: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/green-belt

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to ban any new development on the Green Belt, if that is what you want to happen.

attributes.action: Add  Albania and Kosovo to the Green List for international travel
attributes.background: Add Albania to the green list for international travel
attributes.additional_details: Government added 22 country's in to the Green List, excluding Albania and Kosovo. Both countries have done very well,to fight against Covid 19.due to their hard work cases are dropped.statics are showing 0 Deaths and only 3 New cases in the last 7 days( this for Albania). We strongly believe that the Country is safe from Covid 19.And Country should be in the Green List

attributes.action: Place UAE on green list with home quarantine + early release for vaccinated.
attributes.background: UK citizens arriving from the UAE should be allowed to quarantine from home, due to the wide availability of PCR tests before flying (being able to complete and receive results 48 hours before travel). Additionally, vaccinated individuals should be allowed early release after home PCR test.
attributes.additional_details: The UAE has provided a successful vaccination program and a significant amount of the population has been vaccinated. Whilst this proposed action would be good for the 240,000 expats in the UAE, thousands of teachers and families are are part of this group and would like to travel to UK during the summer holidays - many of whom have not traveled to the UK or seen family for over a year. The hotel quarantine is not suitable for those who have property in the UK and are able to isolate at home.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about travel restrictions on people arriving in the UK from the UAE, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. If the UAE was made a green list country, there would be no need for travellers to quarantine unless they tested positive for Covid-19.

You could start a new petition make it clear whether you want the UAE to be made a green list country, or something else.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

To remove the UAE off the ‘Red List’ by the Summer: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/575787

attributes.action: Remove Congestion Charge at week-ends
attributes.background: The City churches are open on Sundays and the additional £15.00 Congestion Charge is an extra cost for disabled who cannot travel by public transport and need the use of car in addition to the cost of fuel and parking charge - This is an revenue through the back door and not a 'Green' agenda.
attributes.additional_details: The Mayor decision is against Christians coming to worship in Churches, in the City of London - Churches are suffering due to lack of attendance and needs urgent help once the social distance rule is abandoned.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. This is the responsibility of the London Assembly.
You can petition the London Assembly directly: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Prevent local authorities imposing congestion charges outside 6am-7pm Mon-Fri: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/330925

attributes.action: Stop Farnborough Civic Quarter development plans to cut 237 trees!
attributes.background:
We the constituents of Rushmoor District object to the unnecessary destruction of 237 mature trees which would take place if RBC's current plan for the development of Farnborough Civic Quarter goes ahead. 
This action conflicts with RBC's own Local Plan and adversely impacts the community:
attributes.additional_details:
The trees provide shade combating the urban heat-island effect.

They absorb C02 and felling them means the loss of carbon sinks combating climate change. 

Decrease in air quality close to the airport.

People living in the town centre will be affected by noise pollution.

A lack of green spaces has a negative effect on people's mental health. 

It will cause a huge loss of biodiversity and habitat for wildlife.

We are challenging this development on the grounds of RBC's own Local Plan.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local developments are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

Rushmoor Borough Council also has its own petitions scheme, which you can find out about here: https://www.rushmoor.gov.uk/media/h5ioha4n/12_-_new_petitions_scheme.pdf

attributes.action: Remove Paraguay from Red list
attributes.background: Paraguay is showing very few covid-19 cases in recent weeks, they still use face masks even in public areas. We need to see our families. This country has less cases than many current "green list" countries.

attributes.action: Installation of speed reduction humps on the entry to two streets in Tuxford.
attributes.background:
Installation of speed reduction humps on the entry to Burleigh Court and Eldon Green, Tuxford, NG22.

Children play on these two street on the greens next to the roadside within the estates. The safety concerns due to drivers entering these streets at speed are forever growing to local families.
attributes.additional_details: Road safety to ensure children are not at risk due to drivers entering streets at speeds. Road side parking and children stepping out into the road without these measures cause risk daily.

rejection.details:
Decisions about speed reduction methods in Tuxford are a matter for the individual local authority, not the Government or House of Commons. As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

If you are concerned about planning decisions in your area you could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Ban the sale and use of disposable barbeques
attributes.background: The use of the barbeques often lead to green area scars, litter and in some cases fires resulting in Emergency Services attendance.
attributes.additional_details: By banning the sale of the barbeques the problem will be eliminated and it will help our areas of beauty and save money for authorities.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315762

attributes.action: Planting of a National Memorial Forest for the victims of Covid-19
attributes.background: At an appropriate time, a new National Forest would be a living memorial to the many thousands of victims of Covid-19 in the UK and a lasting tribute to the heroism displayed by NHS and other caregivers at this time. One tree planted for each victim lost would represent a major forestation project.
attributes.additional_details: Planting one tree for each life lost would bring about a major new forestation project (at least sq. 20km), in keeping with the 'green recovery' many are hoping to see, whilst commemorating each individual victim. The forest would allow visitors to pay their respects and enjoy the outdoors in a way we were, at times, unable to during the pandemic.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/314071

attributes.action: Remove powers from Ofgem & replace with a regulatory body that’s fit for purpose
attributes.background: Remove a body that’s not fit for purpose and will cripple our country inadvertently pushing us into a 3rd world state.  The energy caps are perverse and the reverse of what a price cap is considering the profit levels of the energy provider owners like Centrica/Shell
attributes.additional_details:
Solar and green power options should be a choice and not forced on us all. It is a pointless act whilst you have industries chugging out greenhouse gases in economies like China and India. 
Until a global change is agreed on the current net zero policy is a virtue signalling death-knell to many of us regardless of our income levels.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want Ofgem to be replaced, but it's not clear what you want to be different about a new energy regulator.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Change the pricing of Renewable Energy so that it is no longer set by Gas Prices
attributes.background: The Government & Parliament should reconsider the pricing mechanism for Renewable Energy in the UK. Electricity generators usually have contracts which tie their price to the “market”, which usually is set by gas. This is horribly outdated and we need to see it changed to encourage green energy.
attributes.additional_details: We are a family of three living in South Devon. We don't want our young daughter's life to be horribly affected by climate change. We signed up to a 100% renewable electricity scheme in 2020 through Octopus Energy. We were happy to pay a premium for this renewable supply of energy over the fossil fuel rate because we believe in leading through positive action. We strongly believe that renewable energy consumers should not be punished by increasing gas prices, as has been the case for our family.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about the increased cost of energy, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. The energy price cap is backstop protection from the government for people who default onto their supplier's basic energy tariff. Ofgem calculates the cap level that suppliers must apply to these tariffs. The cap does not apply to customers that have chosen a standard variable green energy tariff Ofgem has exempted from the cap. For customers on a standard variable green energy tariff it is up to individual energy providers what to charge.

You can find out more about the energy price cap here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/information-consumers/energy-advice-households/check-if-energy-price-cap-affects-you

attributes.action: Make the NHS vaccination recognisable from the EU for people travelling there.
attributes.background: Make a deal with the European Union so that they recognise our vaccine and stop asking for tests.
attributes.additional_details:
The European fully jabbed citizens have a green pass while those vaccinated in the UK have to always purchase a test for everything when in Europe. You need a test from doing simple things such as going to the cinemas, eating indoors to travelling by all means of transport
Being fully vaccinated by the same regognised companies, there should be no discrimination between for instance a fully jabbed British citizen and a fully jabbed Italian citizen. It is clear discrimination and it all starts back at the fact that the UK chose to leave the European Union. During these times the price is paid by simple citizens- especially those that have to travel to the European Union to see their families.

rejection.details:
You may like to sign the below petition we currently have open on this topic:

Seek to agree upon equivalence of NHS Covid pass and European Covid Green Pass
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/593188

attributes.action: Move Portugal to the Covid19 green travel list.
attributes.background: Since the covid restrictions started I only seen my family twice. Maybe for someone who does not share a strong bond with their family it's not a problem and they probably even welcome it, I moved to the UK because I could see them every 6-8 weeks year round. I feel alone, sad and empty.
attributes.additional_details: With the successful vaccination campaign in the UK as well as the continuous successful progress Portugal have produced in their own one, plus the fact statistics show that in the 100,000 of British tourists that visited Portugal, only 6 tested positive... This to me looks like it's now become almost full on political which means there is a reason other than covid that has made the UK gov create legislation to reduce travel to Portugal. Well, that is wrong, unfair and inhumane.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/587911

Help UK house holds reduced there recycling. Bring the green dot system into the UK. 
Make the super stores buy the packaging back like Germany dose.
attributes.additional_details:
Help UK house holds reduced there recycling. Bring the green dot system into the UK. 
Make the super stores buy the packaging back like Germany dose. 

I am from a large family I try to buy refill packs food vegetables with less packaging where possible. I crush Cans bottles but glass takes up far to much space I recycle as much as I can but its fills to fast at theres only so much recycling you can leave outside your home something must chance green dot system needs Implicated

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We understand you'd like to see changes to recycling, but you'll need to set out how this would work, rather than referring an example without an explanation. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Stop destroying wildlife habitats
attributes.background: Thousands of homes are built around the UK if this carries on we won't have any green belt woodland or countryside left. All wildlife habitat will be destroyed and wildlife animals will be pushed to extinction.
attributes.additional_details: Tell them to put a stop to the thousands of homes been built everywhere. the cause of these problems are by illegal immigrants entering the UK they are pushing up the population

rejection.details:
It is not clear what you are asking the Government to do. A number of legislative instruments and guidelines already set out the restrictions imposed upon builders and developers relating to wildlife habitats.

Planning decisions are a matter for local authorities, and not the Government or House of Commons.

You could start a petition calling on the Government to change specific measures that already exist in respect of wildlife habitats when new homes are being planned, but would need to be clear what changes you want the Government to make.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Require Electricity Suppliers to actively promote Carbon Intensity awareness
attributes.background: UK Electricity Suppliers should actively promote Carbon Intensity to domestic customers. Simple decisions about when to charge cars and run appliances for all customers including (counter-intuitively) those on green tariffs can help to reduce the risk of running out of natural gas over winter.
attributes.additional_details: Everyone can play a part in collectively reducing the use of fossil fuels by a significant amount. The winter in Europe is likely to bring disruption of supply for electricity/heating when we run low on natural gas. The UK population could make small changes to more closely match electricity demand to supply from renewables generation by observing Carbon Intensity forecasts to reduce this risk. The National Grid, Oxford University and WWF have already developed a web site and an app for this.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Allow ambulances to utilise green lights to attend urgent medical problems
attributes.background: Change the law to allow ambulances to utilise green light to attend urgent medical issue and prevent the abuse of blue light use when attending non emergencies. It can confuse the public and put people at un necessary risk
attributes.additional_details: This allows ambulances to continue to attend urgent cases in a timely manner but due to the massive increase in non emergency calls blue lights are being used. But when driving on blue light you are 3 times more likely to be involved in a crash. This puts the crews and the public at risk. But utilising the green light could allow road users to know to give way but it’s not a emergency.

attributes.action: A Royal Commission to report within 18 month on coastal defence and tidal power
attributes.background: A Severn Barrage can green South Wales steel and supply huge quantities of energy adjacent to market while defending the coast from sea rise and tidal surges:secure indigenous energy sovereignty against global price/currency fluctuation simultaneously initiate lagoons for Liverpool Swansea Cumbria.
attributes.additional_details: Tidal power is a simple proven technology with out the extreme risks re terrorism of nuclear power which is delegating irradiated waste for 100,000 years with no safe storage options identified by Government and with Windscale/Sellafield clear up approaching 100 billion in cost ; tidal has to be the option at scale balancing the east coast wind factory with long term predictable industrial quantities of power; modern turbines generate almost continuously and intermittency issues are resolved .

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

It's not clear if you want the Government to create a royal commission to develop a tidal energy strategy, or if you just want the Government to invest in tidal energy.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Enquiry and Overhaul of the National Grid Energy Tarriff System.
attributes.background: Develop two wholesale markets - one for renewable and one for brown energy and the ability for the consumer to transparently purchase this energy with a certificate of origin clearly established under the green code transparency.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK energy market (designed by civil servants, regulators, politicians and primarily Oil and Gas companies) has a single market price for electricity - from whatever source it is generated, whether that be clean renewable or gas and coal.

Renewable energy costs, wind, solar, geothermal are generally fixed provision of energy cost without too much fluctuation in operating costs as they are not dependant on feed stock such as gas, coal or fuel oil to generate the electricity.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the electricity market, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

There is not a single price for electricity, and electricity providers generate and buy electricity in a range of different ways. Your petition calls on the Government to create two wholesale markets, but it's not clear how this could be achieved.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to review and reform the electricity market, with a view to increasing transparency about how the electricity customers use is generated, if that's something you'd like to happen.

attributes.action: Recognise EU GREEN PASS for travel to the UK
attributes.background: The European green pass shows a person's covid-19 vaccination status. It allows travel within Europe.
attributes.additional_details:
We need to get the travel industry up and running again.
 It is an obvious step towards normality that has still not been taken.
At the moment only NHS fully vaccinated people are allowed to benefit from the new uplifting of the restrictions travelling from abroad (amber list countries), still stopping so many fully vaccinated loved ones from meeting.

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition the Government has announced that it is waiving quarantine for arrivals fully vaccinated from Europe from 4am on 2 August 2021. You can find out more about this here: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/uk-travel-update-government-waives-quarantine-for-arrivals-fully-vaccinated-from-europe-and-usa-while-also-confirming-international-cruise-restart

We have published the following related petition, which you might like to sign:

Seek to agree upon equivalence of NHS Covid pass and European Covid Green Pass: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/593188

attributes.action: Allow Home Quarantine for Visitors to Red List Countries
attributes.background: It makes sense to now ease the forced hotel quarantine for uk citizens who return from red list countries. This is a very very expensive option and it is highly unfair that double-jabbed UK citizens be forced to pay £1750 for a forced hotel stay when they have their own homes to quarantine in.
attributes.additional_details: It is almost heartbreaking that while holiday makers can go to any of the amber or green list countries, we seem to be forgetting that the UK comprises a high number of ethnicities from countries that may be in the Red List. We cannot even visit family back home as schools break, because most cannot afford the hotel quarantine on top of pricey airline tickets and PCR tests. At least have the humanity to allow us to return to our homes when we return and quarantine there.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/588072

attributes.action: Provide compensation for people who lost money on Portuguese holidays in June
attributes.background: The Government must compensate people who lost money when Portugal went from Green to Amber on the travel list in June 2021
attributes.additional_details:
Thousands of people have lost deposits or 100% of their money due to government misguidance .This also includes covid tests paid for and transfers.
Some people have not been given the option to change the booking and others have had to fly back earlier than planned.

The government said green for go and now we are given a maximum of 5 days to reorganise plans.

attributes.action: Ban selling disposable barbecues without a stand, to prevent grass damage
attributes.background: The Government should make it illegal to sell barbecues without a permanently attached stand for them to be used on. This could be a fold out stand or legs. This would ensure manufacturers stop producing disposable barbecues without such stands.
attributes.additional_details: Parks, natural green spaces and nature reserves are being damaged by people using disposable barbecues with little to no thought of the grass being burnt and long term damage caused.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Scrap the Sewell Report
attributes.background: We want Parliament to debate the fundamentally flawed Commission on Race and Ethnic Disparities report, for the Commission to withdraw it and the government to apologise for failing to ensure it was a fit and proper document.
attributes.additional_details: Leading public health and equalities experts conclude this report is methodologically flawed and insults the experiences of many Black, Asian and Ethnic Minority people in the UK. Dame Doreen Lawrence warns that it gives a 'green light' to racists and sets back the fight for equality back 20 years. Academics named in the report have revealed they were not properly consulted, and an author is having his name removed. As a result of these and other concerns the report should be withdrawn.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/581907

attributes.action: Allow  Green Homes Grant to be used with non-TrustMark tradesmen.
attributes.background: Allow the public to use other reputable tradesman that are not TrustMark approved. Just because a tradesman are not TrustMark approved, doesn't mean they are not reputable. The govt could use lots of other bodies to measure the quality of a tradesmans workmanship.
attributes.additional_details:
There are not enough TrustMark approved tradesman to service the amount of people wanting to utilise the Green Homes Grant. Therefore it is impossible for the public to utilise the Green Homes Grant. 

It is imperative the public can have access to grants, and unfortunately due to the nature of the approved tradesman, the public are unable to utilise the grant.

attributes.action: Cover 100% of Green Homes Grant improvements for all households
attributes.background: Currently the Green Home Grants scheme covers full costs for households claiming certain benefits, but only part of the costs for other households. The Government should cover 100% of costs for all households.
attributes.additional_details: There are also a lot of families who do not claim relevant benefits but have no savings to be able to make use of the Green Home Grants scheme. Just because you don’t qualify for certain benefits doesn’t mean you couldn’t really do with a helping hand to bring your bills down. This should be fair for all.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Keep at least 20% of the land in each town as undeveloped fields or green spaces
attributes.background: At least 20% of the town's total area must be kept as undeveloped green space. Every time I go somewhere, I see people tearing up fields to make room for new roads when the roads still work and I think that one day soon, there will be limited green space left only CO2 and a lack of biodiversity.
attributes.additional_details: I think this should happen because if there are no fields or green space, then there is nowhere for trees to grow and therefore no way to turn CO2 into oxygen for us to breathe so we can stay alive and the less plants there are, the less oxygen there is for us to breathe so it could lead to very significant health problems. Without a plan like this, there will be a huge lack of biodiversity which could lead to extinction for many animals and then lack of food for us.

Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

attributes.action: Increase all fossil fuel price by 2% every month until 2050.
attributes.background: The UK Government must collect an increasingly higher duty on all types of fossil fuel used for all private and business uses. These extra funds must be aimed at fast-tracking sustainable and affordable green energy and support a generational transition to sustainable business practices.
attributes.additional_details: Climate change requires a drastic change in everyone's lifestyle. Fossil fuel is the main cause of it, and we need to stop using it now. Churchill famously said 'I have nothing to offer but blood, toil, tears and sweat', and without a rapid change of course we will soon face food and water scarcity and a breakdown of society as we know it. Collecting more duty from all fossil fuels will force consumers and businesses to change habits and fund a fundamental shift across the entire nation.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

The Government is responsible for setting duties on fuel and other fossil fuel products, but decisions about prices for these products are a matter for manufacturers and retailers, not the Government or Parliament.

As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.

We could accept a petition calling for changes to duties on fuel and other fossil fuel products, if that's what you want to happen.

attributes.action: Change planning and building regulations so new homes meet 21st century needs
attributes.background: Local people need more say over what kind of housing gets built where. Green spaces must not be destroyed to create estates of executive style 4/5 bedroomed houses when local people need 2/3 bedroomed houses or 1 or 2 bedroomed flats. Gas boilers must be banned immediately and source pumps fitted.
attributes.additional_details: The regulations are no longer fit for purpose in the light of the housing crisis, the climate emergency and the levelling-up agenda. Developers are using the green belt to build large executive style houses that a) do not solve the national housing shortage and b) hugely contribute to emissions. Too few affordable homes are built: developers claim they are not financially viable in order to focus on their profit margins. Too many young people and families cannot afford homes to rent or buy.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  We understand you'd like changes to planning regulations, but we're not sure from your petition exactly what changes you'd like to see happen. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Subsidise the cost of Fit-to-Fly COVID Tests
attributes.background: The cost to travel to and from a ‘green-list’ country ranges from £90 to £120 depending on the testing requirements of the country of destination. The government should subsidise this cost partially or entirely to make travel accessible for everyone and support struggling airlines.
attributes.additional_details: The government insists on making holidaymakers pay for ‘Fit-to-Fly’ PRC and rapid flow tests from private health companies despite making rapid flow tests available for free for the UK public.  It is unfair to charge the UK public wishing to revive the travel industry such high rates. For a family of four travelling to a ‘green-list’ country it could cost up to £1,000. This makes travel to 'green-list' countries only accessible to the rich.

attributes.action: Amend building regs to make it mandatory to install Solar on all new houses
attributes.background: Change current building regulations to make installation of solar PV and hot water systems compulsory for all new build domestic property. The government could also subsidise these costs on any housing categorised as ‘affordable’ to further incentivise house builders.
attributes.additional_details: If we want to help meet the UK target for Nett zero by 2050 we should do this now. The current energy crisis underlines this. The technology is available and proven. This would stimulate the Green manufacturing supply chain, create new jobs and develop workforce skills. It would also drive innovation in the sector and give momentum to decentralisation of the power grid.

attributes.action: Don't sell out COP26 by lettings companies like NatWest sponsor it
attributes.background: If the government is serious about making changes to society to save the environment they shouldn't allow companies like NatWest, who invest in fossil fuels, clean up their image and sponsor COP26 without a complete commitment to the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
NatWest score 0/20 on www.ethicalconsumer.org on the environment. This is because they fund fossil fuels. Even their own attempt to look green says they will:
"At least halve the climate impact of our financing activity by 2030 and intend to do what is necessary to achieve alignment with the 2015 Paris agreement."

Which means a bare minimum of change not a complete commitment to change. It means they will continue to fund companies that are contributing to climate change for a further 9 years.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about sponsorship of COP26, but it's not clear exactly what you want the Government to do.

Your petition says the Government should not allow companies to sponsor COP26 without "a complete commitment to the environment", but it's not clear what this would mean in practice.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to end sponsorship deals with companies that do not meet certain requirements, but it would need to be clear what you wanted these requirements to be.

attributes.action: Invest in the environmental infrastructure of the England.
attributes.background: It is time we start to address the decline of our planet by beginning at home, investing in the future wellbeing of our country through mass environmental projects, aimed at increasing the amount of green space (parks, national grounds, wildlands), and the reforesting of the Fells across England.
attributes.additional_details:
I hope you see the value of nature, if not, none of my words can convince you; however, if you do, then see that this is the moral and just thing to do. The amount of job creation would be substantial.

We can easily set an example, here in England to the rest of the world on what they too should be doing; Investing, not just to make more money, but to ensure future generations can thrive. Nature, has given us all we have. Can we please give back. You can do good, and gain the publics love.

attributes.action: Remove VAT from environmentally-friendly products
attributes.background: Many green products products are relatively new to the market and so cost effective manufacturing processes are not yet available, and so some of this cost is passed on to consumers. In addition, these products are sold in smaller volumes because people are reluctant to switch to a green alternative
attributes.additional_details:
Price is at the forefront of any consumer's mind when selecting a product. Environmentally friendly products are often more expensive that the 'regular' equivalent. Consumers are therefore required to pay extra for the benefit of the environment. 
Removing VAT from environmentally friendly products would reduce the price difference between 'regular' products and their environmentally friendly alternatives. This would encourage consumers to switch to the environmentally friendly product.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the environment, but it's not clear what you mean by "environmentally-friendly products".

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, we could accept a petition calling for products that are recyclable, or certified as being carbon neutral, to be exempted from VAT.

The Coast Road which is the direct link to the Quarry is already suffering corrosion and there is plans to move the road away from the cliffs to run along side the Lime Mills
